column4: hey guys. i've installed ubuntu on a PC next to the TV meant primarily for watching videos on the internet, and it's running off a fully fledged install off ubuntu on a USB stick. however performance can sometimes be sluggish - is there any way to increase the amount off RAM used to cache data from the drive?
face it, the bottleneck in performace is the USB bus

definitely, yeah. it's especially annoying when accessing different menus (i'm using the netbook remix) - if there was any way to force it to read those menu items at start up and remember them, it'd be great
strill, the extenal harddisk is still slower due to USB limitations and sure when there are other USB devices connected
